events.name: Celebrate Women's Day with Next'
events.description:
Being a Entrepreneur Women is a challenge, but with many available programs, it recently became an opportunity.

Join us to explore a variety of International Programs Empowering Entrepreneurs Women in our Region.

And hear it directly from the Amazing Alumnae of those programs.

Explore when, where and how to apply and get accepted for a Life changing Experiences! And hear the stories behind and after the change. 

And because it is Google Cloud Next event time, we will be Bringing you the excitement of Next ’17 by exploring the Google CLoud!

events.name: Technical Mentoring for TEC Startups
events.description: A series of short, focused conversations about specific questions. Where mentors meet with a limited number of teams in 10‐minute time slots each review their solution technical , provide advice and insights.

events.name: Introduction to FireBase at Tripoli Startup Forum
events.description:
Tripoli Startup Forum in collaboration with Google Developers Group will be hosting a workshop on how to use Firebase for Android.

For every application, website and tool: Sign Up, Sign In, Validation, Verification, Retrieving lost credentials.. are the most common features.

The features every programmer has to spend time on managing and preparing!

Now FireBase from Google is taking this burden off your shoulders! In only several steps and minimum codes, we will be setting all of above features in an Android App using FireBase."

Only 20 Seats are available!

https://www.facebook.com/events/19105834392123

How to register:

1. In order to attend this workshop, you have to be registered to Tripoli Startup Forum. You can get your free ticket from 

www.tripolistartupforum.com

2. Fill the form in the following link 

https://goo.gl/forms/Q1Uduk6k8XisOQsj1

events.name: Build with Firebase!!!!! With GDE Rayan Zahab!
events.description:
Speaker :
GDE Rayan Zahab
https://developers.google.com/experts/people/rayan-al-zahab

Google's Firebase is a cloud-based database hosting service that will set up a database for you and host it, as well as offer you the tools to interact with it. You can use it to store and retrieve data in real time. That's not all Firebase does, it can do more things like handle user authentication and store files, but we'll be mainly focusing on data storage.

The data storage ability of Firebase make it a perfect fit for React. A persistent, real-time backend for your application to plug in to!

events.name: Women Techmakers and All Girls Code Winter Festivities
events.description:
• What we'll do
All Girls Code Winter Festivities! Our first event for this year is open for registration! Join us for a day full of coding, design, leadership training, and empowerment! The event is, as usual, free of charge, and places are limited, so hurry up, gather your friends, and register! The event is most suitable for ages from 12 to 20 years old. For those of you who are not familiar with All Girls Code, it's an initiative, powered by Google Women Techmakers Lebanon, that aims at providing girls aged between 12 and 20 years old hands-on with coding experience, as well as empowering and encouraging them to embark on careers in the STEAM fields. The program fosters coding skills and analytical thinking through different events and mini-projects that demonstrate to the participating girls the benefits of coding in different domains such as Arts, Storytelling, Medicine, Game Design, Finance, and other fields. It also introduces the participants to several local, regional, and international technology initiatives and conferences that are of help to them as they progress in their careers. Girls who participate in All Girls Code events become part of a growing regional network and a mentorship program that provides continuous support to them all year round!
Register here: https://goo.gl/forms/Cbue7Sw5K2lzTfhG2

events.name: IoT with Esp8266!
events.description:
• What we'll do
We will be running a small workshop to explore the ESP8266 board and its use in IoT applications. 2 applications will be done: 1) application of WiFi geolocator using Google Maps Geolocator API 2) application via ThingSpeak for smart and remote monitoring of plants. Hardware will be supplied by us, but please bring your laptops with Arduino ver 1.8.5 installed. Also please manage the boards to install the ESP8266 chipset package, and install the CH341SER driver beforehand. If possible, also add the zipped libraries ESP8266WiFi.zip, ESPWifiLocation.zip and ThingSpeak.zip from GitHub.

Places are limited (20 seats), and will be on basis of first come first serve. Priority will be given for Lamba Lab Members (extra 10 seats reserved for them).

Beginners are welcomed, but basic knowledge in networks and concepts of programming are preferred.

• What to bring
Laptops!
events.how_to_find_us: keep straight when entering the junction beside Byblos Bank, you'll find a dead end road we are in the last building at the end! A traditional old building

events.name: Pi Party! with Raspberry Pi!
events.description:
• What we'll do
It's March 14th so it's time to celebrate all that is Pi related!! We've come to know Pi all so well, from the symbol π that holds a special place in every math enthusiast's heart, to Raspberry Pi, the small computer that caught the makers' world by storm (especially in the field of IoT), to, of course, your traditional pies that no one minds exploring once in a while ;)

As such, Lamba Labs is co-hosting a #PiParty this Wednesday at 6pm, in collaboration with GDG Coast Lebanon and Google Women Techmakers at their HQ. We will be doing a small tribute to the Pi. Then we will be running parallel workshops to explore the Raspberry Pi (there will be levels: beginner and intermediate).

Places are limited (20 seats), and will be on basis of registration (or first come first serve if registered people did not show up). Priority will be given for Lamba Labs Members (extra 10 seats reserved for them). Registration link will be provided shortly.

• What to bring
LAPTOS!
Hardware will be supplied by us, but please bring your laptops with NOOBS (for beginner workshops), Raspbian (for more advanced workshops), and IDLE Python programming terminal downloaded. We will be uploading a shared URL soon to retract all required material for the workshops.

• Important to know
Complete hardware and programming beginners are welcomed, but basic knowledge in networks and concepts of programming are preferred.

events.name: International Women's Day '18 - IWD
events.description:
It's March so it must be International Women's Month!!

As such, Lamba Labs is co-hosting a celebratory day with GDG Coast Lebanon and Women Techmakers Lebanon. The event is also in partnership with WOMENA. Join us for a chance to win 2 tickets to Step conference* Dubai!

This year saw a lot of efforts for women empowerment and changing the norms, with 2018 being "at the heels of unprecedented global movement for women's rights, equality and justice". Hence, IWD only saw it fit to tag this year's theme as #PressforProgress

Working under this theme, Lamba Labs, GDG Coast Lebanon, and Google Women Techmakers Lebanon Branch is inviting women speakers who have done so much to help build a new Lebanon.

IWD : International Women Day 18
• What we'll do
Google Women Techmakers annually host International Women's Day (IWD) all around the world. This year, IWD is coming to Beirut.
We'll be unveiling more details gradually.

• Agenda
9:00 - 9:30 Registration + Check In

9:30 - 9:45 GDG Introduction + Women Techmakers, Ahmad Zein: GDG Coast Lebanon

9:50 - 10:00 MJ El Azzi (Bioinformatics data analyzer at AUB, AI expert)

10:00 - 10:10 Aseel Honein (Parallel Studio, CEO at Val de Faii, Professor of Construction and Structural Engineering at LAU, Biomimicry Expert)
https://www.linkedin.com/in/aseelhonein/

• What to bring
Laptops with Arduino 1.8.5; required material for the workshop can also be found here: https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/mobile/folders/1jWuZsGMuJ20A49Lu8VSKJHIpOGrzzXp0

• Important to know
Basic knowledge in C or Arduino are preferred.

Preferred color of attire is purple (not the entire thing of course, just a hint :D)

*conference tickets only

events.name: BAU Mobile Application Fair
events.description:
The event will be of mutual benefit for the students, alumni, and participating organizations alike. It provides an excellent opportunity for exhibitors to present their ideas and applications to put them in real. The first electronic mobile applications fair is an event that embraces the talents specialized in the field of electronic applications, and focuses on the innovation and creativity. It opens the door to Beirut Arab University graduates to deliver their ideas and applications to the world. In addition to the focus on the new issues in the programming of mobile applications and follow the global electronic market and the technical investment part in the revival of this field.

events.name: IoT in Healthcare

venue.name: BDD1079 Building
venue.address_1: Bechara El Khoury, Beirut Digital District

events.description:
This event will introduce what is IoT and how it is used nowadays in the field of health care. It will then explore current medical equipment and products based on IoT (international products and local start-ups). A demo of measuring ECG (electrocardiogram) signal with Arduino NodeMCU and Thingspeak will follow. Finally, a hands-on workshop on reading pulse oximetry with Arduino Wemos D1 Mini, Thingspeak and IFTTT will be given.

• Main Speaker: Alaa Salam | Lamba Labs

• Detailed schedule:
- 9am to 9:30am: registration
- 9:30am to 10:15am: Intro to IoT and Its Use in Healthcare (followed by brief Q&A)
- 10:15am to 10:30am: break
- 10:30am to 11:15am:
Explore Current Solutions (International and Local) of IoT in Healthcare
-11:15am to 11:45am: Demonstration on ECG Recording with Arduino NodeMCU and Thingspeak
-11:45am to 12pm: break
- 12pm to 2pm: Hands-on Workshop: Pulse Oximetry with Arduino, Thingspeak and IFTTT

• What to bring
Hardware will be supplied by us, but please bring your laptops with Arduino ver 1.8.5 installed. Also please manage the boards to install the ESP8266 chipset package, and install the CH341SER driver beforehand. If possible, also add the zipped libraries ESP8266WiFi.zip and ThingSpeak.zip from GitHub. Further more, please start an account on IFTTT platform (Webhooks connected), and an account on Thingspeak.

Places are limited, and will be on basis of first come first serve.

Beginners are welcomed, but basic knowledge in networks and concepts of programming are preferred.

events.name: Hands-On with Android Things
events.description:
•Description

In this workshop, you will learn everything you need to know about developing IoT applications on Android Things. Using Android Studio and a developer kit, you will see how easy it is to use your Android knowledge to interact with hardware in the real world.

•Prerequisites

Android Studio 3.1.3
Update your SDK tools to version[masked] or higher The updated SDK tools enable you to build and test apps for Things.
Update your SDK with Android 8.1 (Oreo), API 27 or higher The updated platform version provides new APIs for Things apps.
- Download this app on your phone : https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.things.companion

•Instructor: Mohammad Touban - Raed Zain

events.name: Game Zanga 8 - (Game Jam) Beirut
events.description:
We are happy to announce that this event will happen in both Tripoli and Beirut thanks to the effort of Ahmad el Kerdi and Amin el Eit.
This event is co-organised with the help of GDG Coast Lebanon and Women Techmakers, and is sponsored by Unreal Engine!

Welcome to the largest game development event in the Arab World
GameZanga is an event for game development enthusiasts all over the Arab World and beyond.

The Zanga, known in English as a “Game Jam” is one of the most popular game development activities in the world. It brings together developers of all skill levels and to meet, learn from each other, experiment and develop games within a short time period and based on a specific theme. Game Jams are usually no longer than a weekend and the theme ensures all games are made within the jam time. It also offers a challenge and helps push participants to innovate and think outside the norm.

The Zanga is open to game development enthusiasts of all ages, backgrounds and skill levels, whether you are an industry professional or you’ve never made a game before. The obstacles to development are practically non-existent these days and there are free development tools available. Some tools make it possible to create fun games without needing to write a single line of code as well as plenty of content and libraries that you can use in your games for free. This is a great opportunity to be surrounded by game developers that you can direct all of your questions toward.

GameZanga is a non-profit initiative by the GameTako community to promote and support the game industry. It is now organized by volunteers from game dev communities across the Arab World.

The 8th GameZanga will take place from the 17th (Friday) to the 19th (Sunday) of August 2018. Participants can join one of multiple local jam sites in different cities or jam remotely online if no jam site is available nearby.

You can interact with Zanga participants in the community section here or in the GameZanga section of the Arabic Game Developer Network forums (Arabic Game Developer Network forums). You can also join the official GameZanga Discord channel (https://discord.gg/M3tFsCS)

For more information please visit the GameZanga section of the Arabic Game Developer Network forums.

Enjoy the Zanga and don't forget to share your photos with us using #GameZanga

More info itch.io/jam/gamezanga8

Register for free here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1e_wOOF-61jm1JkZGH6-wPLedTqhMEHF6_c8O6vXLlkg

events.name: Game Zanga 8 - (Game Jam) Tripoli
events.description:
We are happy to announce that this event will happen in both Tripoli and Beirut thanks to the effort of Ahmad el Kerdi and Amin el Eit.
This event is co-organised with the help of GDG Lebanon and Women Techmaker, and is sponsored by Unreal Engine!

Welcome to the largest game development event in the Arab World
GameZanga is an event for game development enthusiasts all over the Arab World and beyond.

The Zanga, known in English as a “Game Jam” is one of the most popular game development activities in the world. It brings together developers of all skill levels and to meet, learn from each other, experiment and develop games within a short time period and based on a specific theme. Game Jams are usually no longer than a weekend and the theme ensures all games are made within the jam time. It also offers a challenge and helps push participants to innovate and think outside the norm.

The Zanga is open to game development enthusiasts of all ages, backgrounds and skill levels, whether you are an industry professional or you’ve never made a game before. The obstacles to development are practically non-existent these days and there are free development tools available. Some tools make it possible to create fun games without needing to write a single line of code as well as plenty of content and libraries that you can use in your games for free. This is a great opportunity to be surrounded by game developers that you can direct all of your questions toward.

GameZanga is a non-profit initiative by the GameTako community to promote and support the game industry. It is now organized by volunteers from game dev communities across the Arab World.

The 8th GameZanga will take place from the 17th (Friday) to the 19th (Sunday) of August 2018. Participants can join one of multiple local jam sites in different cities or jam remotely online if no jam site is available nearby.

You can interact with Zanga participants in the community section here or in the GameZanga section of the Arabic Game Developer Network forums (Arabic Game Developer Network forums). You can also join the official GameZanga Discord channel (https://discord.gg/M3tFsCS)

For more information please visit the GameZanga section of the Arabic Game Developer Network forums.

Enjoy the Zanga and don't forget to share your photos with us using #GameZanga

More info itch.io/jam/gamezanga8

Register for free here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1e_wOOF-61jm1JkZGH6-wPLedTqhMEHF6_c8O6vXLlkg

events.name: Let's Discuss Security !!
events.description:
AUST STUDENT BRANCH PROUDLY PRESENTS
Let's Discuss Security Event !!
This event will cover main topics regarding cyber security, it's definition and importance. The presentation will raise awareness on the topic of Security and will teach basic concepts of how to keep your system secure
Event outline:
• GREETINGS
• WHO WE ARE?
• INTRO TO CYBERSECURITY
• WHY ITS IMPORTANT?
• TRNDING TOPICS
• DISCUSSING CYBERSECURITY
• OPEN DEBATE
• HOW HACKERS ACCESS OUR PHONES, COMPUTERS, etc.….?
• COFEE BREAK ~10min
• HOW TO STOP HACKERS FROM HACKING US?
• SECURING YOUR COMPANY
• WHY RELIABILITY IS IMPORTANT?
• ADVANCED NETWORK’S SECURITY
• COULD WE STOP COMPANIES FROM STEALING OUR DATA?
• Q&A AND NETWORKING

events.name: Build Actions for your Community
events.description:
• What we'll do
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

**More Details will be updated soon...

“Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to community organizers worldwide. You can offer opportunities to developers attending your events to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, they can build something in an area that they care about or are interested in.

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

events.name: A Day in the Life of A Field Engineer
events.description:
session by By Alaa Salam
https://www.linkedin.com/in/alaa-salam-04073b2b/
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Details
Women in Engineering (WIE)-IEEE-AUB Branch invites you to its LEAP Conference on Saturday, November 17th, 2018!

LEAP (Lead, Empower, Aspire, and Progress) will be a one-day celebration of successful, inspirational women from different fields including politics, engineering, entrepreneurship, medicine, journalism, and more!

Our guest speakers include:
-MP Paula Yacoubian (politician, activist, and journalist)
-Reem Acra (internationally renowned designer)
-Sarah Abdallah (co-lead of Facebook Developer Circle Beirut, CEO of LIBRO, social and political activist)
-Darine Hamze (actress and social activist)
-Nour Atrissi (co-founder and CEO of TeensWhoCode)
-Nathalie Nasreddine (founder of Pink Steps initiative for breast cancer survivors)

The event also includes networking sessions and multiple workshops, including some given by Google Developers Group & Women Techmakers Lebanon! Our amazing sponsor, Latte Art lebanon, will keep you extra satisfied with delicious treats!

The event is free of charge, but registration is a must:
https://goo.gl/forms/z13h2PAfxffBe1eg2

Date: November 17, 2018.
Time: 2:00 to 6:00 PM
Place: ELH Auditorium, Masri Building, AUB

events.name: Digital Future Day 2018

venue.name: BDD1280 Building
venue.address_1: Bechara El Khoury, Beirut Digital District, Beirut

events.description:
The event is about highlighting startups and initiatives that are making an impact on Lebanon's Digital future. GDG Coast Lebanon will be giving a workshop from 4:30 - 5:00 pm about ML Kit in firebase.

There's also a Game Jam leading up to it starting on Nov 16.
https://www.facebook.com/events/573748426363824/

• What we'll do
Learn how to use the Machine Learning Kit for Firebase to easily add advanced machine learning capabilities to your application. This workshop will cover text recognition, facial features, and objects in images.

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know
Android Studio 3.0+ should be installed
Android Studio Emulator or an Android Device
Basic knowledge in Java
Basic understanding of Machine Learning Models

** Excited to meet you all at our booth.

events.name: Celebrating WTM International Women's Day 2019 IWD19 & Arduino Day 2019
events.description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation for women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

Is it only for women?!
We strive to have a broad representation of attendees in tech including developers, designers, technology entrepreneurs, and many others across all phases of their careers, backgrounds, genders, and walks of life. We welcome all to apply!

• Agenda for the Day:
________________________

9:30am - 10:00am:
Registration
10:00am - 10:20am:
Opening Ceremony - Alaa Salam & The Olive Grove
10:25am - 10:40am:
Women in Engineering IEEE Intro - Dr.Sirine Taleb
10:40am - 11:10am:
Women in Field Service Engineering - Eng. Alaa Salam
11:10am - 11:40am:
AI for Everyone - Alaa Maarouf
11:40am - 12:05pm:
My Journey Through Sustainable Fashion- Ayah Hoteit
12:05pm - 1:05pm:
Lunch
1:10pm - 4:10pm:
Workshop 1: Smarty Pants Plants - IoT Home Plants Monitoring System (Based on Wemos D1 Mini board; platforms used include Ardunio IDE - Thingspeak - IFTTT) - Presented by Eng. Alaa Salam
1:10pm - 4:10pm:
Workshop 2: Mini UX Masterclass - Presented by Fadi Bou Debs
4:10pm - 4:30pm:
Closing Ceremony & Raffle*

* Raffle eligibility rules: must participate in one of the workshops and be present throughout whole day

• What to bring
Laptops with Arduino 1.8.5 installed (for those partaking in the workshop); required material for the workshop will be announced soon

• Important to know
Basic knowledge in C or Arduino are preferred.

Preferred color of attire is purple (not the entire thing of course, just a hint :D)

group_profile.title: Founder
group_profile.intro: UI/UX Designer and Developer, with a background in graphic design started my career focusing on webdesign then got into the development starting with Action Script for game development to interactive web application, and cross platform mobile apps.
